subsection_name: loang-xuong.json_9_How to care for sick people
subsection_content:
Nutrition
People with osteoporosis should have a healthy diet to control, prevent disease progression, and best support disease treatment.; Nutrition principles for people with osteoporosis need to ensure adequate amounts of vitamins, minerals, and calcium; Prioritize choosing fresh, clean food ingredients; When taking care of elderly patients, family members should grind food into small pieces and divide it into several meals a day. In addition, older people often have difficulty absorbing nutrients because their digestive system has aged. Therefore, family members can discuss with doctors about supplementing supplements and functional foods for patients.
Reference: What should you eat and avoid if you have osteoporosis?
Move your body
People with osteoporosis when exercising should pay attention to warming up before exercising and relaxing the body after exercising. Before exercising, you need to warm up for about 10 - 15 minutes with simple movements such as standing up, sitting down, jogging on the spot. After exercising, the patient should relax the body for about 5 - 10 minutes by relaxing the whole body and taking deep breaths. In addition, elderly patients should avoid exercises that have a strong impact on the bones, especially exercises that change positions suddenly.
Prevent falls
Falling is an extremely dangerous situation for people with osteoporosis. Therefore, in daily activities, patients need to pay attention to:
Avoid going out alone, do not move on slippery, rocky, gravelly, bumpy ground; Make sure all areas of the house always have enough light.; The floor should be dry, clean, and tidy. Carpets or wooden floors can be used to avoid slipping and limit the risk of falling for patients.; Install additional handrails on stairs or bathrooms. Family members should stay next to the sick person to help move up and down stairs or when necessary.; Patients should wear shoes with anti-slip soles; Elderly patients should be careful when using drugs that cause dizziness or vertigo because they can affect movement and easily cause falls.; Regularly re-examine periodically
Osteoporosis treatment can last about 3 - 5 years. Patients should maintain the habit of regular check-ups, use medication according to doctor's instructions, and re-measure bone density every 1-2 years. This will help assess disease progression and response to treatment. Through the examination results, the doctor will evaluate the overall condition of the disease and the level of osteoporosis, thereby recommending further treatment.

Tran Anh Vu; Dr. Tran Xuan Anh, Dr. Le Dinh Khoa, Dr. Do Tien Dung; Dr. BS.CKII Vu Huu Dung... This is also one of the pioneer units in diagnosing and treating musculoskeletal diseases with modern techniques according to updated international protocols.
The hospital is also equipped with modern machinery and imaging equipment such as: Somatom Drive 768-slice CT scanner, new generation Magnetom Amira BioMatrix magnetic resonance machine, Artis Pheno robot, densitometer. bones, ultrasound machines...; Opmi Vario 700 Zeiss surgical microscope system, Meera-Maquet operating table... to be able to detect injuries early and effectively treat musculoskeletal diseases...
Tam Anh General Hospital also owns a spacious clinic system and high-class boarding area; modern rehabilitation area; Comprehensive post-operative care process helps patients quickly recover and stabilize their health after surgery.
To schedule an examination and treatment with leading experts at the Orthopedics Center, Tam Anh General Hospital, please contact:
Aging of the musculoskeletal system is very difficult to avoid. However, you can still slow down the progression of osteoporosis through diet and lifestyle. In addition, as soon as signs of osteoporosis are detected, patients should go to the hospital for examination, diagnosis and timely intervention to prevent dangerous complications.
